Data: Pretorius to Warner, FOUR runs pitched up outside off, Warner leans into a business-like crunch down the ground, beats long-off running across! Giddy up!
Pretorius to Warner, no run length on the stumps, pulled flat and hard but straight to midwicket
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run 134kph on middle and leg, clipped through square
Pretorius to Finch, 1 run full on the stumps and again worked off the legs to the man on the fence
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run pitched up and poked towards mid-off coming forwards, a misfield gifts them a single
Pretorius to Finch, no run tight lines from Pretorius, blocked
Tahir to Warner, no run scuttles in and floats the ball on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
Tahir to Warner, 1 run tossed up outside off stump, Warner stiffs one down the ground to long-off
Tahir to Finch, 1 run flighted, straightening on the stumps, controlled paddle through backward square leg

Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs targets the leg-side boundary, a flat sort of slog-sweep-drive and it's into the gap between deep mdiwicket and long-on - brutish stuff and Warner has his fifty, from 41 balls
Tahir to Warner, no run tossed up a bit slower outside off, pushed to cover
Tahir to Warner, no run finishes with the googly, as Warner comes out, covers the line and blocks
Pretorius to Finch, no run beats the bat, decent line from Pretorius, maybe a bit of nibble as Finch stays back and swishes at it
Pretorius to Finch, 2 runs slightly short and this is rifled off the back foot to deep point, where Amla tumbles to make a good stop

Pretorius to Finch, SIX runs pitched up and fetched into the crowd, another breezy tinkle over the fence from Finch, walloped into the crowd at long-on (well caught, too) and that takes him to an even quicker half-century, from 32 balls
Pretorius to Finch, 1 run on the stumps, maybe an offcutter, worked through the leg side
Pretorius to Warner, no run good length on middle and off, turned to midwicket
Pretorius to Warner, no run beats the bat, Warner glanced back furtively as he tried to dab to third man, didn't get anything on it

Tahir to Finch, OUT launched into the sky, but it lobs to mid-off, Tahir makes the breakthrough! One big hit too many for Finch, sent it pretty much straight up and he has to head straight off, as Tahir weaves away in trademark arms-whirling high-fiving celebration. Twas the googly that did it
Tahir to Warner, 1 run floated up outside off, Warner clubs it down the ground
Tahir to Smith, no run flighted, around off stump, Smith props forward to block
Tahir to Smith, no run tosses up the legbreak, Smith leans out and gets an inside edge defending
Tahir to Smith, 2 runs very full, outside off and squeezed through the covers on the drive
Tahir to Smith, 1 run on the stumps, possibly the googly and Smith turns it around the corner to backward square leg
Pretorius to Smith, no run Pretorius puts the ball on a length, pushed back down the ground
Pretorius to Smith, no run tight stuff, 129kph but Smith moves on to off stump and blocks again
Pretorius to Smith, no run wicket-to-wicket stuff, Smith happy to get his eye in
Pretorius to Smith, no run slower ball this time, Smith had wandered outside off and was looking to work to leg, gets a leading edge
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run fullish on the stumps and this time he gets the leg glance working
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run touch back of a length and Warner stays on top of the bounce to punch one more to deep cover
Tahir to Warner, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, Warner pushes to long-on
Tahir to Smith, no run tossed up outside off, Smith pats it away defensively
Tahir to Smith, 1 run goes back in the crease and works a length ball behind square on the leg side
Tahir to Warner, 1 run legbreak on the stumps, stays in the crease and flicks off his hip
Tahir to Smith, no run tossed up, Smith drives a bump ball back to the bowler, Tahir clinging on running to his left
Tahir to Smith, 1 run slower delivery, Smith waits and works one more off his pads behind square to keep the strike
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, Smith punches back down the ground
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run comes across to drive a length ball square, brilliant pick up and throw from Rossouw, had Smith hurrying
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run on the stumps, Smith nurdles one more through the leg side
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run fullish, in the channel, driven through the covers coming forward
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run shuffles across on off and drills another single down the ground to long-on
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run angled across, 135kph and Warner steers another single through the covers - all gone a bit pedestrian after the destruction derby of the opening ten. Consolidation time
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 run whipped out to deep square
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run back of a length outside off, Smith on his toes and punched to point
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run well bowled, this nips back off the seam and beats Smith's inside edge as he plays away from his body
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run a shorter delivery, rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square

Phehlukwayo to Warner, 2 runs that's a loose delivery, short again, down the leg side, Warner pulls and I think it comes off the glove so doesn't have much pace on it which allows long leg to get around
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run punched sweetly off the back foot to cover, there's a fumble but they can't steal a single
Duminy to Smith, no run plays back and defends to midwicket
Duminy to Smith, 1 run width outside off, Smith gives himself a touch of room and drives square through the covers
Duminy to Warner, no run goes back and drives to cover
Duminy to Warner, 1 run fuller, drilled down to long-off
Duminy to Smith, 1 run whips a full ball from outside off down to long-on
Duminy to Warner, no run round the wicket, full and straight, defended to the leg side
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run length ball outside off, defended into the covers
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run throws his hands through some width and slices the ball down to third man

Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run big appeal for lbw as he goes for the pull, the ball skids on more than imagined, but did it pitch outside leg? They decide not to review. Was above the knee roll as well
Phehlukwayo to Warner, FOUR runs that's crunched! Some power there from Warner, drags a short ball from outside off thunderously through midwicket. Fielders barely moved
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run slower ball, nudged to midwicket
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 run short on leg stump, tucked off the hip down to long leg
Duminy to Warner, 1 run opens the face a touch and drives wide of the cover man inside the circle
Duminy to Smith, no run pushed into midwicket from outside off
Duminy to Smith, 1 run touch short outside off, chopped into the ground and it rolls towards cover...it's a tight-ish single, but Warner is so quick
Duminy to Warner, 1 run nearly drags this on...aiming a drive through the covers, he was through his shot a fraction early, takes a thick inside edge between his legs
Duminy to Smith, 1 run pushed down the ground
Duminy to Warner, 1 run drives this in the air, but it goes just wide of cover...stopped his shot, perhaps the ball stopped a little, but he was just able to get it wide of the fielder
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 wide a loopy bouncer which is called wide
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run full at the stumps, defended back to the bowler
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 run opens the face and punches square off the back foot
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run full outside off, picks out backward point as he drives
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run on a length outside off, defended to cover
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run full outside off, good pressure being built, Smith defends towards mid-off
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run goes onto the back foot and steers a back-of-a-length ball through the off side
Duminy to Smith, 1 run pushed off the back foot to long-on
Duminy to Warner, no run stretches forward and pushes back to the bowler
Duminy to Warner, 1 run driven off the back foot to deep cover
Duminy to Smith, no run defends on the walk to cover
Duminy to Smith, FOUR runs dragged down short, Smith swings away a pull stroke, beats square leg and gets his first boundary
Duminy to Smith, 1 run pushed down the ground to long-on
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run doesn't quite get his timing as he drives to cover
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run very full outside off, driven to deep cover
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 wide pushed down the leg side, de Kock does well to get his right-hand mit down to it
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run a slower ball, full and straight, pushed to the covers
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 wide down the leg side again, more tumbling for de Kock to do
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run back outside off stump, it's a sweetly-struck square drive but he picks out backward point
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run full ball at off stump, squeezed off a thick outside edge to backward point
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 2 runs played off the back foot through the off side, good placement wide of the sweeper allows him back for a second
Duminy to Smith, 1 run full outside off, comes forward and drives through the covers
Duminy to Warner, 1 run round the wicket, full outside off, driven hard towards cover who parries it away as he dives
Duminy to Smith, 1 run goes back outside leg to a shorter ball and cuts to deep point
Duminy to Warner, no run very full, jabbed to the off side
Duminy to Warner, no run worked into the leg side where midwicket gets across
Duminy to Warner, no run opens the face, drives to cover...a decent period for South Africa continues
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run full outside off, driven to cover, well fielded by David Miller
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run opens the face and drives through point
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 run slower ball outside off, pushed down the ground
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run comes forward and defends square to point
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run brings his bottom hand into play as he whips this from outside off down to long leg
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 2 runs takes advantage of some width outside and drives square but Amla is able to get around the cover boundary
Duminy to Smith, 3 runs more work for Amla at deep cover, this time to get around to intercept Smith's drive which was almost placed well enough to find the boundary
Duminy to Warner, 1 run short outside off, cut to deep cover
Duminy to Smith, 1 run played out to deep cover
Duminy to Warner, no run full and straight, Warner can't beat the bowler with his drive
Duminy to Warner, 1 run worked off the pads into square leg
Duminy to Smith, 1 run round the wicket, pushed across Smith who drives to deep cover
Tahir to Smith, no run driven on the up to cover
Tahir to Smith, no run drives a fraction early at a googly, takes a thick inside edge
Tahir to Smith, 1 run fuller, driven straight back past the stumps and long-off comes around
Tahir to Warner, 1 run excellent fielding to back up the bowler, was dropped a touch short outside off, Warner cuts but Rossouw flings himself to his left

Tahir to Smith, 1 run another South Africa fielder flinging himself around, the captain this time, and du Plessis almost manages to create a brilliant run out as he back-hand flips the ball towards the non-striker's stumps with Smith well short
Tahir to Warner, no run dabbed behind square
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run almost drags this on, it's a full ball outside off, his feet don't move much and he's playing away from his body but the toe end dribbles wide of the stumps
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run full and straight, driven to long-off
Pretorius to Smith, FOUR runs that's sweet from Smith, stands tall and drives between cover and mid-off...super piece of timing
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run worked down to long-on
Pretorius to Warner, FOUR runs stand and deliver! Jeepers, that went like a rocket. Full ball outside off, a touch slower, and Warner clubs it straight down the ground
Pretorius to Warner, FOUR runs he's kicking on again, deft touch this time as he opens the face and steers this smartly wide of backward point towards third man. That's classy
Steyn to Smith, no run back of a length at off stump, defended
Steyn to Smith, 1 leg bye shuffles across the crease and pulls a back-of-a-length delivery to long leg
Steyn to Warner, 1 run driven out to deep cover
Steyn to Smith, no run takes the pace off a little, Smith plays back to the bowler

Steyn to Smith, no run big appeal for lbw, this looks tight! Smith shuffling across his stumps again, aiming to the leg side with a bottom-hand shovel, and Steyn was pleading. But they don't review. Line and height an issue
Steyn to Smith, FOUR runs that's dispatched, dragged shorter and wider by Steyn, Smith doesn't miss out as he drives behind square with power and placement
Tahir to Warner, no run full at off stump, gets forward and defends
Tahir to Warner, no run drives behind point with an open face
Tahir to Warner, no run can't beat the off side as he drives
Tahir to Warner, 1 run missed stumping, that could be a huge moment! Was a very full ball, Warner aimed to work it to leg, glanced off the back pad towards de Kock with Warner well down the crease
Tahir to Smith, 1 run driven to deep cover...that's Australia's 200
Tahir to Warner, no run tucked away from leg stump to midwicket
Steyn to Smith, 1 run length ball at off stump, pushed towards the mid-on area and it's judge as a sharp single with midwicket unable to get across
Steyn to Warner, 1 run whips a length ball into midwicket
Steyn to Smith, 1 run punched through the off side
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs throws his hands through a wide delivery, was aiming over point but it flies off a thick top edge fine of third man...takes him to 99
Steyn to Warner, 1 run there's his hundred! Knocks the ball down by his feet and Smith calls him through. A superb innings, 96 balls, and still plenty of time left
Steyn to Smith, 1 run worked off the body to deep square
Tahir to Smith, 1 run uses his feet then whips along the ground through midwicket
Tahir to Warner, 2 runs short outside off, cut through point and wide of the cover sweeper
Tahir to Warner, 2 runs driven off the front foot this time, and again the sweeper can't cut off the second
Tahir to Warner, no run fantastic piece of fielding at cover by Miller as he flings himself low to his left to cut off a rifled cover drive
Tahir to Warner, 1 run plays this straighter, down to long-off
Tahir to Smith, 1 run driven to long-off,,,brings up his fifty
Duminy to Smith, no run starts with a short ball but gets away with it as he crunches it to cover
Duminy to Smith, FOUR runs doesn't escape this short ball as Smith rocks back and pulls a long hop over midwicket...that was a bit of freebie rubbish
Duminy to Smith, 1 run outside off, flat-batted to deep cover
Duminy to Warner, no run goes for the reverse sweep, misses, and it's well taken by de Kock...glanced off the back arm
Duminy to Warner, 2 runs steps outside leg and then hammers this towards cover who can't stop it cleanly and although the ball barely left the fielding circle Warner comes back for a second
Duminy to Warner, no run gets across onto off stump then sweeps but picks out short fine leg
Tahir to Smith, 1 run goes back outside off and steers a drive through cover point
Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs that's outrageous from Warner, opening up now, essays a sort of reverse-slog-sweep and scoops the ball high over backward point, bounces away to the fence
Tahir to Warner, SIX runs slogged conventionally this time - and it goes all the way! Tossed up and creamed into the stands at deep midwicket. Think Warner heard Gnasher's call...
Tahir to Warner, no run pushed across and tapped into the covers

Tahir to Warner, OUT slogs again, but this one won't clear the rope... well taken by long-on running in! Tahir finally induces another mistake, having got Finch earlier, but Warner has played a superb knock. Was looking to plant Tahir into the stands again but went pretty much straight up
Tahir to Smith, 1 run googly, spinning in on the stumps, worked back down the ground
Rabada to Smith, 1 run shortish on the stumps, worked through square leg
Rabada to Bailey, no run good length, 133kph on the stumps, squirted towards mid-on from the crease
Rabada to Bailey, 1 run back of a length, dropped into the covers, this is going to be tight.... Miller swoops, Smith would have been well gone, but the underarm is off target! Smith had given up
Rabada to Smith, no run played back down the track
Rabada to Smith, no run shortish, 137kph outside off, defended into the off side
Rabada to Smith, no run back of a length outside off, pulls across the line but the ball shoots through under the bat
Tahir to Bailey, 3 runs looped up outside off, Bailey gets the reverse-hit going, top-edges fine of short third man and Smith runs hard for three
Tahir to Smith, no run tossed up and punched towards mid-off
Tahir to Smith, no run quicker ball, beats the outside edge as Smith goes back to cut
Tahir to Smith, 1 run quick and flat, comes forward to drive, Tahir gets fingertips to it
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run flighted, Bailey gets forward and drives through the covers
Tahir to Smith, 1 run slow loopy legbreak outside off, Bailey drops back and steers one more through point
Rabada to Smith, 1 run length ball, 137kph outside off, steered through backward point
Rabada to Bailey, 2 runs sliding on to the pads, Bailey clips behind square and they get back for two
Rabada to Bailey, 1 wide 140kph but fired down the leg side
Rabada to Bailey, no run slightly short outside off, Bailey dabs it to backward point
Rabada to Bailey, 2 runs steps out to loft over the infield, slightly screwed to leg but it plops safely to earth
Rabada to Bailey, 1 wide loses his line down the leg side once again
Rabada to Bailey, no run pitched up on off, punched short into the off side
Rabada to Bailey, 3 runs terrific bit of work on the boundary from Amla here, chasing a leg glance full pelt along the rope and just managing to flick it back and save a run
Phehlukwayo to Bailey, 1 run Lucky puts the ball on the spot outside off, Bailey pushes towards mid-off for one
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 2 runs waits in the crease and flicks to leg, into a gap and they come back for a second
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run good length, 136kph on the stumps, punched back past the bowler
Phehlukwayo to Bailey, 1 run slightly short, flapped through mid-on on the pull
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run slower ball, slightly short and leg side, Smith spoons it up towards backward square leg... and gets away with it, no one near as it lands
Phehlukwayo to Bailey, FOUR runs deals with the full toss, Bailey sends his first boundary scudding flat and hard through backward point. Puts a cherry on the over
Rabada to Smith, no run good length outside off, 136kph and stabbed into the covers
Rabada to Smith, 1 wide digs this in, very short and slightly leg side, Smith watches it through
Rabada to Smith, 1 run length outside off, 139kph and dropped short into the off side for a strolled single
Rabada to Bailey, no run leg-side yorker from Rabada, following the batsman, hits Bailey on the boot as he swings across the line
Rabada to Bailey, 1 run full and straight again, this time Bailey chops it into the leg side
Rabada to Smith, no run touch back of a length, 143kph and rising outside off, Smith steers it to backward point
Rabada to Smith, FOUR runs too leg side from Rabada and Smith cashes in, skelping four down to fine leg with a swish of the blade
Phehlukwayo to Bailey, 2 runs starts with a cutter, outside off and it sits up to be larruped through point to the sweeper
Phehlukwayo to Bailey, 1 run fired in as Bailey skips out, gets a sort of bottom-edgey chop away through mid-on
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run short, another slower ball, Smith waits and panhandles it down through midwicket for one
Phehlukwayo to Bailey, SIX runs full pace, touch too straight and Bailey whips what was effectively a half-volley all the way over the rope at deep midwicket... Sweetly timed

Phehlukwayo to Bailey, OUT got him, brilliant catch in the covers! Lucky's slower ball does the trick, though Bailey must have thought he'd collared it, opening the shoulders and slapping in front of square, only for du Plessis to hurl himself to his left and cling on to a pearler two-handed
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run sprayed down the leg side, must have flicked the pad on its way through
Tahir to Smith, 2 runs tossed up on the stumps, Smith advances and flicks through midwicket
Tahir to Smith, 2 runs slightly short, stays low and pulls into a gap, again they hustle back for two
Tahir to Smith, 2 runs quicker outside off, drops back and splunks a drive in front of deep cover, good running again
Tahir to Smith, no run ooh, that's a beauty, Adam Zampa will have noted the turn for Tahir there, spinning a legbreak sharply past the outside edge as Smith played from the crease
Tahir to Smith, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, nurdled through backward square leg
Tahir to Marsh, no run slower, flights the legbreak on middle and leg stump, rolls away off the pad
Steyn to Smith, no run slower ball, outside off and steered towards backward point with an open face

Steyn to Smith, SIX runs dismissively done, the arms windmilling through, Smith takes a length ball from off stump and swings it high over deep square leg... Not the way to make friends with Dale Steyn
Steyn to Smith, no run maybe a touch slower, dabbed down into the covers this time
Steyn to Smith, 1 run tip and run, struck rather firmly towards mid-off, Marsh has to get a shift on... the throw misses!
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run fullish outside off and driven past extra cover to the sweeper
Steyn to Smith, 1 run digs in the bouncer at 141kph and Smith clubs it cross-batted down to long-on
Tahir to Smith, 1 run whipped off the legs, Smith thought there was a second in the offing - but no
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up on the stumps and pushed to mid-on
Tahir to Marsh, no run gives it some air, Marsh goes down and sweeps hard, fails to connect
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run tossed up and punched down the ground to long-off
Tahir to Smith, 1 run pushed through, slightly short outside off, Smith drops back to cut through point
Tahir to Marsh, no run flighted, straightening on off, Marsh presses forward with bat next to pad - Tahir finishes with a mighty respectable 2 for 54 from his 10
Steyn to Smith, 1 run shortish outside off, steered through point on the back foot, that's the Aussie 300 up

Steyn to Marsh, OUT short ball, Marsh cracks a pull... only to be bagged by another great catch at midwicket! Miller the man on this occasion, diving low to his left and clinging on to give Steyn a wicket and just check Australia's momentum a fraction
Steyn to Head, no run easier said than done, though, as Steyn bounces him by way of hello
Steyn to Head, 1 run full and wide, pushed across the lefty from over the wicket, dragged down the ground to long-off
Steyn to Smith, 1 run back of a length and flicked off the hip to deep-backward square leg
Steyn to Head, FOUR runs short outside off, Head swings across the line, gets a bottom edge... and it will squirtle away to the boundary, beating fine leg and leaving Steyn with a bit of a funk on
Phehlukwayo to Smith, FOUR runs starts with a short ball, well outside off and Smith almost leaps to swing a top edge away over short third man, scoots to the fence to take him to 94
Phehlukwayo to Smith, FOUR runs lashed through point, lovely stroke, authentic square drive and it's back-to-back boundaries for Smith, two shy of his hundred now
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run short ball, steps out and swipes across the line, doesn't quite get hold of it and Lucky chases it to midwicket to keep them to one
Phehlukwayo to Head, 1 run shortish, at the body and pulled flat through square leg for one

Phehlukwayo to Smith, FOUR runs full outside off, Smith steps out and crunches another boundary, a crisp drive in front of square - off comes the helmet in celebration of his sixth ODI hundred, and a timely one given Australia's circumstances
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run short outside off, maybe a slower ball, Smith opens up and clouts one out towards the cover sweeper
Steyn to Smith, FOUR runs Smith's strike rate rises smoothly above 100 as he steps across and whirls Steyn away over backward square leg for four more

Steyn to Smith, OUT bowled him, Smith misses a slower ball! He tucks his bat under his arm and walks off, a fantastic knock but he won't go any further... Made a bit of room and was looking to steer through the covers, done by the lack of pace as Steyn sent a cutter into off stump
Steyn to Wade, 1 run comes forward and pushes a single through mid-on to get off the mark first ball
Steyn to Head, 1 run length ball on the stumps, Head heaves across the line and gets a single to deep midwicket
Steyn to Wade, 1 run angled across, length ball taken on the up by Wade, steered through cover
Steyn to Head, 2 runs tries to hit over the top, flat-batted and coming off the top edge but it clears mid-off for a couple
Rabada to Wade, SIX runs short ball, slightly leg side and Wade swings violently up and over the rope, the ball flying in an arc for six over fine leg
Rabada to Wade, 1 run rolls the fingers over the ball, full and wide of the stumps and squeezed through point
Rabada to Head, 2 runs short ball, pulled in the air, Phehlukwayo is running in off the rope... but he drops it! Tough chance as he ran in but looked like he made the ground
Rabada to Head, FOUR runs short again and this is spanked over midwicket, doesn't quite have the legs to go all the way but four more to the total
Rabada to Head, no run gets away with a full toss as Head steps to leg, swings and misses
Rabada to Head, 2 runs pushed across, 139kph and a touch full, slapped through point and they hurtle back for two
Steyn to Wade, 1 run slightly back of a length, makes room and swats a pull down the ground
Steyn to Head, SIX runs slower ball, Head picks it up, launches a slog towards cow... all the way! Takes Australia past 350 with another sweet-and-sour (for the bowler) strike into the crowd
Steyn to Head, FOUR runs full outside off and crashed through the covers this time, that'll be four more!
Steyn to Head, 1 run pitched up and dug out through mid-on for one
Steyn to Wade, 2 runs length ball, possibly a cutter, Wade is forward and in position to ramp the ball, nearly a catchable chance to fine leg but he can't quite get there running in
Steyn to Wade, FOUR runs and still the runs continue to flow, a full-blooded mow down the ground bringing Wade four more, a full ball in the slot and clubbed over the infield
Rabada to Head, 1 run makes a bit of room, swats a single through point
Rabada to Wade, 1 run cuts his fingers over the ball, full outside off and Wade can't get under it, one down the ground
Rabada to Head, FOUR runs full and straight but slugged back down the ground, Rabada fractionally misses his mark and Head slams it for four
Rabada to Head, 2 runs gets this one up a bit further towards the blockhole, dug out back past the bowler and they scamper a couple
Rabada to Head, no run slower-ball bouncer, loops and dips and beats Head's swing across the line

Rabada to Head, OUT full toss to finish and Head top-edges a slog pretty much straight up, Rabada running across to his right to take the catch - although he almost collides with du Plessis running in from cover! They check the delivery for height but it's just the right side of a no-ball, so the innings finishes with a wicket, Head and Wade's

5pm: So, South Africa will need 372 to win the match and take the series. However you slice it, that's a tall order. Hundreds for David Warner and Steven Smith provided the sturdiest of bedrock and then the blitz from Head and Wade - who gorged on the death bowling to the tune of 46 from 22 balls - iced a very plump-looking cake. In the process, Dale
Hello folks, welcome back. This is one heck of a chase for South Africa. Amla and de Kock in the middle
Tremain to de Kock, no run full, wide outside off, driven to cover
Tremain to de Kock, FOUR runs that's a lovely piece of a timing, a punchy drive through the covers as Tremain over-pitches outside off
Tremain to de Kock, 1 wide tries to adjust his line, gets to straight, hint of swing takes it down the leg side

Tremain to de Kock, 2 runs back outside off, another flowing drive from de Kock although not quite timed so well this time...deep point gets around. And, well, Amla's bat got stuck in the ground as he tried to run it in and a direct hit might have been out. What a way that would have been to go
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run threading the off side, this time straight to the sweeper
Tremain to Amla, no run works a straight delivery to mid-on
Tremain to Amla, 1 run uses his bottom hand to tuck a delivery off the stumps out to deep square
Worrall to Amla, no run on a length outside off, moves way late but Amla holds his bat inside the line
Worrall to Amla, no run full outside off, strongly driven to square cover
Worrall to Amla, no run back of a length at off stump, 144kph/89mph, defended
Worrall to Amla, 1 run angled into the pads, worked into square leg
Worrall to de Kock, no run round the wicket, full at off stump, plays forward and pushes to mid-on
Worrall to de Kock, 1 run nips in off a good length and brings a big appeal for lbw, looked high and maybe outside the line...hmm, touch closer than it looked. On the knee roll
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run full at off stump, takes something of a leading edge along the ground through cover
Tremain to Amla, 1 run tucks a straight delivery to deep square leg
Tremain to de Kock, no run round the wicket, on off stump, worked to mid-on
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run fuller this time, flicked but he can't beat mid-on
Tremain to Amla, 1 run picking it off his pads again as Tremain gets a little too straight
Tremain to de Kock, 2 runs nicely timed through the leg side, using the angle into him, flicked in front of square but it's hauled in by Adam Zampa
Worrall to Amla, 1 run aiming to work a back-of-a-length delivery to the leg side and gets a thick outside edge which loops over the bowler and short of mid-off
Worrall to de Kock, 1 run and now there's a leading edge from de Kock as he aims to work Worrall to the leg side and ball shoots through point
Worrall to Amla, no run drives on the up at a length delivery and finds cover
Worrall to Amla, FOUR runs makes something out of this as he walks right across his stumps then whips a back-of-a-length delivery over short fine leg
Worrall to Amla, FOUR runs and now he's timed that superbly square of the wicket, on his toes and punches it at the top of the bounce behind point

Worrall to Amla, FOUR runs brilliant batting! Worrall tries to correct himself, goes to full, Amla latches on with a crisp cover drive which is through the covers before anyone barely moved. He's up and running
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run smart work at backward point by Warner as he dives to cut off de Kock's open-faced guide
Tremain to Amla, no run slower ball outside off, defeats Amla as he aims through the off side
Tremain to Amla, no run beaten again, this time he goes over the top of the ball as he tries to cut
Tremain to Amla, FOUR runs slips onto the pads and that's timed beautifully through midwicket as Amla just leans on his flick shot...no brute force in that
Tremain to Amla, FOUR runs there's more power in that! Dropped in short and Amla dispatches it with a fierce front-foot pull over midwicket
Tremain to Amla, no run gets away with this one, it's full and angling onto the pads, flicked firmly by Amla but straight to short fine leg
Worrall to de Kock, no run beaten as he tries to drive on the up
Worrall to de Kock, no run drives powerfully but the ball slides off the face to short third man
Worrall to de Kock, no run drags the length back, on off stump, de Kock defends it down by his feet
Worrall to de Kock, 1 run trying to flick this through the leg side again and it's a leading edge through backward point
Worrall to Amla, 1 run opens the face and runs it to third man
Worrall to de Kock, no run this one gets through him, some zip off the pitch, angles back at de Kock from round the wicket and goes under his bottom edge
Hastings to Amla, FOUR runs that's thrashed over the off side, a short ball which Amla deliberately lifts over the covers and it's not far from going all the way
Hastings to Amla, FOUR runs goes for the pull this time, comes from high on the bat and just has the legs to clear mid-on then skips away over the outfield
Hastings to Amla, 1 run slower ball outside off, guided down to third man
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run nearly gets this down to third man, which is unprotected, as he back-cuts a short ball but Warner just gets across from backward point
Hastings to Amla, no run fuller, at the stumps, flicked to midwicket
Hastings to Amla, 1 run short of a length, punched off the back foot into the covers
Worrall to Amla, no run that has climbed off the surface from back of a length and beaten Amla's expansive drive
Worrall to Amla, 1 run carved down to third man
Worrall to de Kock, 1 run worked from outside off into the leg side, feeding Amla the strike
Worrall to Amla, no run full and straight, whipped to midwicket
Worrall to Amla, FOUR runs the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives this over the off side but it's well clear of the infield and he collects another boundary
Worrall to Amla, FOUR runs that's lovely batting, just eases a straight delivery through midwicket with a bottom-handed flip...it's flying off Amla's bat
Hastings to de Kock, 2 runs he gets this through the off side with a drive, the sweeper is able to get around
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run width outside off and square driven to the point sweeper
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run worked towards mid-on
Hastings to de Kock, no run round the wicket, defended into the leg side
Hastings to de Kock, FOUR runs that's an excellent piece of batting, he was almost cramped for room as the ball angled in at him but was still able to slice it away wide of short third man
Worrall to du Plessis, 1 wide full, angled down the leg side
Worrall to du Plessis, no run on middle, defended back to the bowler
Worrall to du Plessis, no run comes forward into a punchy on drive
Worrall to du Plessis, no run driven off the back foot to the covers
Worrall to du Plessis, no run touch of extra bounce from back of a length, du Plessis looks a little surprised by that as he spars into the off side
Worrall to du Plessis, FOUR runs finds the gap this time, short of a length outside off, just a little turn of the face to bisect the space in the off-side ring
Worrall to du Plessis, 1 run heaved into the leg side, a touch more ungainly on that occasion
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run slower ball on off stump, punched to deep cover
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run driven out to deep cover
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run played out to deep cover again
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run short outside off from round the wicket, cut through point, got over the top of the bounce
Hastings to du Plessis, FOUR runs stays on leg stump which opens up the off side and that means a ball that wasn't that wide can be slotted through point
Hastings to du Plessis, no run plays a straight delivery to the off side
Marsh to de Kock, 1 run round the wicket, full outside off, driven to deep cover
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run full and straight, steered through the off side to deep cover
Marsh to de Kock, FOUR runs that's a meaty blow, fetches it from full outside off and heaves it over wide mid-on...the face closed on his hands but he retained control of the shot
Marsh to de Kock, 1 run full outside off, jabbed to deep cover
Marsh to du Plessis, no run back of a length, 134kph, pushed back towards the bowler
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run opens the face and dabs a length ball behind point
Hastings to du Plessis, no run full and straight, defended to cover
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run off the back foot, driven to the off-side sweeper
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run full outside off, angled down to third man from a controlled outside edge
Hastings to du Plessis, no run angled into the pads, can't work it away
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run full at off stump, a slower ball, driven down to long-off
Hastings to de Kock, no run round the wicket, short of a length, de Kock tries to pull it away but the ball skims under his bat and isn't that far from taking leg stump
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run dabbed into the off side
Marsh to de Kock, SIX runs that's de Kock at his best! Another slower ball, full outside off, he picks it and drives it clear over long-off...handsome way to reach three figures
Marsh to de Kock, 1 run out to the cover sweeper
Marsh to du Plessis, no run full on the stumps, drives to mid-on

Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs picks up a back-of-a-length delivery outside off and plays a skimming pull off the front foot well in front of square...and even came off low down the bat, still raced to deep midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, no run can't angle this wide of backward point
Zampa to de Kock, FOUR runs that's another pristine drive by de Kock, full outside off, and it's played all along the ground between cover and mid-off
Zampa to de Kock, 1 run goes back to a short ball and almost swings himself off his feet as he hoicks towards midwicket
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs short again, du Plessis rocks back and pulls this in the air over midwicket, one bounce to the boundary
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run on the stumps, driven to deep cover
Zampa to de Kock, 1 run gets this one fuller, flicked down to long-on
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs beats point as he drives square and the brace means it's 13 off Zampa's first over
Head to de Kock, FOUR runs swept from outside leg stump down to fine leg and that takes de Kock to a 36-ball fifty
Head to de Kock, no run
Head to de Kock, SIX runs dragged down short and hammered over deep midwicket...that was a rubbish delivery
Head to de Kock, 1 run now he steps to the leg side and drives through the covers, wide of the sweeper
Head to du Plessis, 2 runs round the wicket, full outside off, drives off a thick outside edge fine of short third man
Head to du Plessis, 1 run pushed down the ground
Zampa to du Plessis, no run pushed into the off side
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run dropped and there was the chance! Given a touch more air, lured into the drive, and it was sharp to Smith's left at cover. Not easy, but need to be taken
Zampa to de Kock, 1 run played out to deep cover
Zampa to du Plessis, no run comes forward and drives to cover
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run flipped over the leg side out to deep midwicket
Zampa to de Kock, 1 run worked off the pads into square leg
Head to de Kock, 1 run round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
Head to Rossouw, 1 run tossed up and pushed back down the ground
Head to de Kock, 1 run comes forward and dribbles a drive through mid-on
Head to Rossouw, 1 run shouts from the bowler as he gets one to grip a bit, nudged into the covers
Head to de Kock, FOUR runs low full toss and that spoils an otherwise decent over as de Kock swats it through deep-backward square leg for a boundary
Tremain to Rossouw, no run round the wicket, shortish and Rossouw pulls, gets a bottom edge to Wade's right, he dives after it and does really well to prevent a run
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run pitched up a bit further, comes forward and strokes through the covers
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run length on off, dropped into the off side, easy single there
Tremain to Rossouw, no run on the stumps, worked back towards the bowler
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run touch too straight from Tremain and Rossouw works it off his legs
Tremain to de Kock, 2 runs short and pulled, de Kock miscues this slightly but he was aiming for the big gap at cow and the top edge lands safely between two men
Head to Rossouw, 1 run floated up on off stump, Rossouw taps it back through mid-off
Head to de Kock, 1 run flat outside off, bit of width and de Kock slides a cut away through point
Head to Rossouw, 1 run tossed up, closer to the stumps and Rossouw opens the face to drive square
Head to de Kock, 1 run de Kock gets on to the front foot and pushes another single through point
Head to Rossouw, FOUR runs there's the boundary ball, Head drops short and Rossouw is quickly into position to batter a fierce cut in front of the deep cover sweeper
Head to Rossouw, 1 run slightly short again, pushed through and chopped to the man in the deep for one more
Tremain to Rossouw, no run length ball in the channel, tries to make a bit of room but fails to connect
Tremain to Rossouw, no run good bowling, does him with the change-up, cutting his fingers over the ball to get a bit of extra bounce

Tremain to Rossouw, 2 runs short and wide and Rossouw is off his feet to crack an uppercut over backward point, gets plenty on the hot but Aaron Finch does brilliantly sliding along the rope to grab it one-handed and prevent four
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run angled in on the pads, clipped to short fine leg and they take on the throw

Tremain to de Kock, OUT touch short and de Kock pulls, h-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-g-e top edge and it swirls above Worrall coming in at fine leg... but he holds on! It was a spectacular take in the end, diving flat out because he was slightly out of position. The burly fast bowler proves he has good hands and that's a massive wicket for Australia
Tremain to Rossouw, no run drops back and lets the bouncer go
Zampa to Duminy, 2 runs starts over the wicket but slightly leg side and Duminy flicks off his pads, into a gap and they race back
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run waits in the crease and plays with the spin to backward square leg this time
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run floated up on middle and leg, Rossouw clips through midwicket
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run dragged down slightly, Duminy spoons his pull slightly, in the air but well short of long-on
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run pushed through, goes back and pulls, along the ground to deep square leg
Zampa to Duminy, 2 runs tossed up, on leg stump and Duminy gets down to paddle fine, possibly off the pad... Zampa appeals twice, but the umpire, Joel Wilson, presumably felt it pitched outside leg
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run chipped, over the bowler's arm and the head of the umpire, just a single down the ground
Tremain to Duminy, no run angled in on the stumps, Duminy prods to the on side
Tremain to Duminy, no run good pace, 141kph from Tremain, on off stump and knocked back in the direction of the bowler
Tremain to Duminy, 3 runs dug in short and Duminy takes on the pull, not quite out of the middle but well in front of deep midwicket for three
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run length outside off, 143kph and sliced down to third man
Tremain to Duminy, 1 run comes across and punches on the up to the cover sweeper
Zampa to Duminy, no run tossed up on the stumps and prodded back to the bowler
Zampa to Duminy, 1 leg bye another lbw appeal, Wade joining in this time, the ball deflects behind point... pitched outside again?
Zampa to Rossouw, no run tossed up and tapped back down the track
Zampa to Miller, no run tossed up, maybe the googly, Miller blocks back to the bowler
Zampa to Miller, no run pushed through on the stumps a bit quicker, Miller defends again
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run pushed across from over the wicket, Duminy steers through cover point
Marsh to Miller, no run shortish, 136kph and sliced off the back foot, well stopped at backward point
Marsh to Miller, no run comes forward and taps into the covers
Marsh to Miller, no run fuller and straight, Miller screws his on drive to midwicket
Marsh to Miller, no run on the stumps, Miller gets on to the front foot but finds mid-on
Marsh to Miller, 1 run goes round the wicket, length outside off, Miller gets off the mark with a punch square
Zampa to Miller, no run floated up on leg stump, turned to midwicket along the carpet
Zampa to Miller, 1 wide pushes this one down the leg side into Wade's pads
Zampa to Miller, 1 run floated up on the stumps, this time Miller works the single to deep midwicket
Zampa to Duminy, no run pushed through and tapped back to the bowler
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run gives this a bit of air, angled across and Duminy skips out, drives to extra cover, who's back far enough to allow a single
Zampa to Miller, no run tossed up outside off, goes for the reverse-dab but can't get it past short third man
Zampa to Miller, 1 run flighted, outside off stump, pushed firmly to the right of mid-off and they trot the single
Marsh to Miller, 1 run comes across and steers to the off-side sweeper
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run pitched up in the channel, driven through the covers on the walk
Marsh to Miller, no run slightly short outside off, Miller stabs it down towards point
Marsh to Miller, no run Miller finds extra cover with a drive on the up
Marsh to Miller, 1 run slightly back of a length in the channel outside off, steered down to third man
Marsh to Duminy, no run tight line on off stump, Duminy defends
Zampa to Miller, SIX runs Miller's timed that pretty well! Tossed up on leg stump and he absolutely murders a flat sweep over deep midwicket
Zampa to Miller, no run pushed through quicker on middle and off, tapped away
Zampa to Miller, FOUR runs tossed up and that's in his wheelhouse, slogged towards wide long-on, in the air but in control and it bounces away
Zampa to Miller, FOUR runs four more, blootered towards long-off this time! Picked the googly and opened up the body and launched it to a vacant part of the field, just one bounce to the rope
Zampa to Miller, 1 run flat trajectory on the stumps, Miller pushes gently into the on side, his work done for the over
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run on the stumps, nudged into a gap
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run Duminy waits in the crease and prods a length ball through point
Marsh to Miller, 2 runs round the wicket, pitched up at 129kph and punched square on the walk, Finch has to run around it in the deep to throw with his left hand and Miller hurtles back for two
Marsh to Miller, 1 run full outside off, driven to long-off
Marsh to Duminy, no run full again, Duminy pings a drive out of the middle but Smiffy throws himself to his right at extra cover to reel it in one-handed
Marsh to Duminy, no run presses forward and opens the face, steered to backward point

Marsh to Duminy, no run full outside off, 131kph and comes off the toe of the bat back to the bowler... hang on, they've appealed for this. The umpires confer for a bit but decide it was a bump ball. Which it was
Hastings to Miller, no run round the wicket, pitched up and driven back to the bowler
Hastings to Miller, 1 run good length, comes across and slices a drive down to third man
Hastings to Duminy, 1 run pitched up, 134kph in the channel, Duminy pokes it back down the ground for one
Hastings to Miller, no run tight lines from Big John, dabbed down towards backward point
Hastings to Miller, no run another dot, Miller moves across on off, steers a length delivery towards point
Hastings to Miller, 1 run pitched up, 134kph and lashed through cover point to the sweeper
Marsh to Miller, 1 run slightly back of a length, Miller waits and opens the face to steer it behind the diving Warner at backward point
Marsh to Duminy, 2 runs fullish, Duminy creeps forwards and drives firmly wide of long-off, they come back for a second
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run length in the channel, Duminy opens the face and runs to third man
Marsh to Miller, 1 run pitched up and driven down the ground, Miller's definitely hobbling as he heads to the non-striker's end
Marsh to Duminy, no run fullish outside off stump, punched to extra cover
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run taking the pace off slightly, in the channel and Duminy rocks back to guide a single to third man

Hastings to Duminy, OUT slapped high into the leg side - but he's picked out the man on the rope! Oh dear, not sure what Duminy was thinking there, a short break in play and that's the partnership scuppered. Swung across the line and Finch barely had to move, a step to the left and clutched to his chest
Hastings to Miller, no run on the stumps, Miller drops down into the on side
Hastings to Miller, 1 run pitched up and punched on the move down to long-on
Hastings to Pretorius, 1 run goes back outside off and dabs a single to third man
Hastings to Miller, no run good-length delivery, 134kph outside off, Miller guides it to backward point - lot on his shoulders now
Hastings to Miller, 1 run on the stumps and whipped with a flick of the wrists through midwicket
Worrall to Miller, SIX runs well if anyone is capable of something special... Miller makes a bit of room and lashes a perfectly respectable length ball several rows back over long-off! Cleaned up
Worrall to Miller, FOUR runs goes short and Miller sits back to pull, nicely placed, swatted through an untended backward square leg
Worrall to Miller, no run better line, 137kph on off stump, pushed square
Worrall to Miller, 1 run Miller comes forward and drives a single back past the bowler
Worrall to Pretorius, no run banged in short and Pretorius is not interested in playing at that
Worrall to Pretorius, no run another bouncer from Worrall and Pretorius ducks it again

Hastings to Miller, no run Miller leaves his crease and aims a slog down the ground, big appeal for a catch behind, mainly from Wade... and Australia review. Hard to see any deviation but Wade seemed pretty convinced. Is there anything on Snicko? No, not really, don't think we have Hot Spot available so it's as you were
Hastings to Miller, 1 run length on off, 127kph and Miller prods down into the covers, sets off straight away - testing that ankle - and mid-off doesn't collect it cleanly
Hastings to Pretorius, 1 run short ball, Pretorius sits in the crease and paddles it around the corner for one
Hastings to Miller, no run length on the hips, clipped firmly but straight to square leg
Hastings to Miller, SIX runs fetch that, into the crowd again! Hastings is just fractionally short here and Miller latches on to an absolute beast of a flick-pull over deep midwicket
Hastings to Miller, no run beats the bat, maybe nipped off the pitch, trying to go leg side again
Worrall to Pretorius, no run a bouncer, over his head
Worrall to Pretorius, SIX runs he's nailed this one! That's a skimmer for six. Dropped in short, Pretorius saw it early and pulled it with immense power over deep midwicket
Worrall to Pretorius, no run back of a length on off stump, punched to cover
Worrall to Pretorius, no run opens the face to third man
Worrall to Pretorius, no run fuller, a slower ball which actually grips a little, an off-cutter, takes an inside edge into the pad
Worrall to Pretorius, 1 run worked away off the stumps to long leg
Marsh to Pretorius, 1 run on a length outside off, steered to third man
Marsh to Miller, 1 run round the wicket, angled in at off stump, pushed towards backward point
Marsh to Pretorius, 1 run slower delivery outside off which he runs down to third man
Marsh to Miller, 1 run full and straight, flicked into midwicket
Marsh to Pretorius, 2 runs gets inside the line and tucks this off his hip through square and they do well to convert that into a couple considering Miller is limping (more so after that)
Marsh to Pretorius, no run flicks a length ball to the on side, Marsh dives across but think mid-on would have stopped the single
Worrall to Miller, 1 run tucked into the leg side and that takes him to a 45-ball fifty
Worrall to Pretorius, 1 run flicked off the stumps wide of mid-on
Worrall to Miller, 1 wide oh dear, that's gone a bit wrong, a slower ball slips out so wide it barely hits the pitch
Worrall to Miller, FOUR runs after going too wide outside off he then pushes this onto the legs - Miller moving around his crease - and gets flicked to fine leg
Worrall to Miller, 1 run drags the length back, on off stump this time, worked into mid-on
Worrall to Pretorius, 1 run swings a back-of-a-length delivery to deep square
Worrall to Miller, FOUR runs uses the angle into him from round the wicket and gets another boundary, flicks this away off the stumps wide of short fine leg and beats deep square
Marsh to Pretorius, no run tucked to midwicket
Marsh to Pretorius, no run almost a mix-up here as this is worked towards mid-on but Miller doesn't want to move
Marsh to Pretorius, no run picks out midwicket again as he flicks this off his body
Marsh to Miller, 2 runs the batsmen crossed, Miller flicks this off his pads to long leg and manages to get back for a second although Lucky had to get a shift on
Marsh to Miller, 1 run driven to deep cover
Tremain to Miller, no run down the pitch outside leg stump and has a big waft at a short ball outside off
Tremain to Miller, FOUR runs that's a lovely piece of batting, stayed in his crease, waited for the ball then open the face to glide it wide of the keeper and fine of short third man
Tremain to Miller, FOUR runs now he goes over the off side, and there's a misfield at deep cover by Finch which makes it into a boundary...that was sloppy
Tremain to Miller, 1 run flicked into square leg

Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run big appeal for caught behind! Not given...Australia don't have a review left. Nicely bowled, in the channel outside off, was very close to the edge. Wade went up straightaway. There was a sound. Yep, Snicko shows an edge!
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run defended with bat and pad together to backward point
Marsh to Miller, 1 run nearly defeats Miller with a slower ball but he manages to hold his shape and gets a toe end to long-off as he comes down the pitch
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, no run stays round the wicket, length ball, defended to the off side
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, no run comes onto the front foot and drives firmly to cover but it's another dot ball
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, no run another good-looking drive but he can't find a gap as he picks out mid-off
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, 2 runs gets this one square through the off side and comes back for the second
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, FOUR runs another mistake in the field! This time Warner at midwicket as Phehlukwayo flicks this off his pads, along the ground, and it goes under the hands.
Tremain to Miller, no run back of a length slower ball, Miller is through his shot early
Tremain to Miller, 1 run driven on the up to deep cover
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run tight on off stump, no width to play with, defended to point
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, 1 run full and straight, flicked down the ground
Tremain to Miller, 1 run full outside off, heaved along the ground to deep midwicket
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run driven to backward point
Marsh to Miller, no run short of a length, cannons into Miller's back hip as he misses his pull...ouch, more pain for him
Marsh to Miller, 1 wide that's a very short bouncer which loops over Miller's head
Marsh to Miller, SIX runs that's big! Gets underneath a full ball and launches it straight down the ground...in the arc and he swung the line
Marsh to Miller, 1 wide pushed wide outside off, another extra delivery...some pressure back on Marsh
Marsh to Miller, 1 run back on off stump, dabbed to backward point
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, no run can't beat backward point this time as he opens the face
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, no run driven to cover
Marsh to Phehlukwayo, 1 run another leading edge which loops over and wide of the bowler down to long-off
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run cut into the off side, can't beat point
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run well bowled, gets the yorker in outside off, inside edge into his pads
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, 1 run driven down the ground to long-off
Tremain to Miller, 1 wide full, speared down the leg side, missed the pads...another wide
Tremain to Miller, no run well bowled, a slower ball, defeats Miller as he tries to drive
Tremain to Miller, 1 run driven to deep cover to bring up 300
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run driven off the stumps to midwicket
Hastings to Miller, 2 runs length outside off, cut through point and cover has to get his skates on
Hastings to Miller, SIX runs big swing...and huge! Picks this up from outside off and lofts it clear into the stands over wide long-on...this is bubbling up nicely
Hastings to Miller, 1 wide over the wicket now, and fired way outside off stump...the wides are stacking up

Hastings to Miller, FOUR runs terrific shot, Miller playing a blinder! It was a wide yorker, but Miller manages to squeeze it over backward point and split the deep fielders. A late turn of the face. Such skill
Hastings to Miller, 1 run short ball, pulled powerfully out to deep square leg who manages to get his body behind it
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, no run not quite so easy for Lucky, he tries to drive this ball from outside off and it skews to midwicket
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, no run back of a length at off stump, can't beat backward point but Miller at least has the strike
Tremain to Miller, 2 runs crunched through the off side off the front foot, driving at the top of the bounce, wide of the sweeper
Tremain to Miller, FOUR runs what a hundred! He keeps finding the boundary, swings away a short-of-a-length ball behind square on the leg side...a composed celebration, he knows this game is on him
Tremain to Miller, 1 run an important stretch by Hastings at short third man, Miller opened the face and he almost got it through...The Duke stuck out his left hand
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run low, straight full toss which he can only drive to cover

Tremain to Phehlukwayo, FOUR runs what a moment for him to find the rope, that's a lovely lofted cover drive to an over-pitched wide delivery, may have been a slower ball, yes it was, and he placed it perfectly
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, 1 run swung hard down the ground to long-off
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 run miscues this towards long-off, comes high off the bat, but falls into space and it gets Miller back on strike
Hastings to Miller, 1 run over the wicket, a yorker at off stump, driven to deep cover
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 run he's trying to cut loose as well now, but doesn't find the middle on this occasion, clubs this straight down the ground off somewhere near the toe end

Hastings to Miller, FOUR runs the fielding has been a shambles in the last 20 minutes and this is another howler! Through the legs of short fine leg from nothing more than a think inside edge by Miller. That's a shocker
Hastings to Miller, 1 run full, very wide, gets the toe end to cover then has to get the dive out! It's all happening. What a match
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 run heaves a length ball into the leg side, finds long-on and he'll have the strike this time
Worrall to Phehlukwayo, 1 run a yorker which isn't far off getting through but he gets a thick inside edge out to deep square
Worrall to Miller, 1 run full at middle and leg, clipped along the ground out to deep midwicket
Worrall to Phehlukwayo, no run priceless dot ball, slightly slower and it deceived Phehlukwayo as he went for the pull...took a bottom edge and mighty close to leg stump
Worrall to Phehlukwayo, FOUR runs what a shot! Anything Miller can do...Lucky goes up and over the off side, a wonderful inside-out lofted cover drive as he's given a hint of width
Worrall to Phehlukwayo, 1 run crunched out to deep cover

Worrall to Miller, SIX runs that's huge!!! Onto the roof at deep square leg. A magnificent pick-up shot off his legs with a effortless swing of the arms. But he was offered length which is very hittable. Still, a humongous blow. Bounced out of the ground by the looks of it
Zampa to Phehlukwayo, no run swing and a miss outside off, an appeal for a stumping and it goes upstairs...was the googly. Did he keep his foot grounded? Yes, he's well back
Zampa to Phehlukwayo, no run another dot! Phehlukwayo thinks he can bring out the reverse-paddle-sweep...he misses, and almost falls over. Miller needs to have a word
Zampa to Phehlukwayo, SIX runs maybe Miller just said smash it! That's what he's done. Zampa dragged that down horribly and Lucky as pulled it over deep midwicket.
Zampa to Phehlukwayo, no run now he goes right across outside off and goes for the sweep, gets taken on the pad
Zampa to Phehlukwayo, 1 run now the reverse sweep, a single to deep cover...he's doing it his way, that's for sure
Zampa to Miller, no run gets a dot in at Miller as he slaps this to cover, and it means he starts the next over off strike (although it may not matter)
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 leg bye round the wicket, short ball, he goes for the pull (or wild hoick) and gets taken on the back shoulder...bounces towards Wade and they scramble the leg bye
Hastings to Miller, 1 run full and straight, drilled to long-on

Hastings to Phehlukwayo, SIX runs that's outta here! What a stroke from Lucky. That could be the deciding blow. Hastings came round the wicket, it was on a length, and he just swung cleanly through the line to send it over wide long-on
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 leg bye goes for the pull, off the body again towards the keeper...South Africa won't care how they come
Hastings to Miller, 1 run over the wicket, low full toss at leg stump, for a second it looked liked he middled this into the gap but it's do the man at deep midwicket

Hastings to Phehlukwayo, FOUR runs he's done it again! What an innings from the new man. Short from round the wicket and Phehlukwayo effortlessly swivels on a pull turned hooked which nearly carries all the way to fine leg
Zampa to Miller, 1 run full outside off, driven sweetly to long-off...no need for anything silly
Zampa to Phehlukwayo, 2 runs and he wins it with a reverse sweep! Gets enough bat to clear short third man and the celebrations start
Right, what an evening. That just about wraps things up from here. Hope you enjoyed over coverage. For now, from Gnasher and Alan, it's goodbye and thanks for joining us.

You did think that when de Kock and Rossouw went in quick succession that the task would be too much for South Africa. Remember, too, that Miller picked up an injury early in his innings but he kept his cool so well. He knew he could find the boundary when needed. Has to be said, however, that Australia's fielding fell apart towards the end
South Africa won by 4 wickets (with 4 balls remaining)
Player of the match is David Miller, SA
